content: I count on this app to keep me healthy & informed about Covid-19. It's very helpful & it gives me peace of mind. But I still follow all the advice about prevention of this virus!! #26. (matt)

I need space on my phone so I will be deleting for now. Will get again if Covid situation gets worse in the Fall! Thank you!!!

It's a bit of a joke. All it did was slow the battery, and the one notification I actually got I was with friends and we got some notification that somebody we didn't even know. When that happened I got rid of it I said sorry about the positive test but who is this guy. I do live in an apartment so it might have been someone else's guest but he wasn't in my house.
Only good if people update. Exposed multiple times but this was the tracer.
I try to install, keep getting "Somthing went wrong..."
replyContent: We'll look into this issue for you. Please send us a note at DPH.CovidAlertCT@ct.gov so that we can follow up.

content: Great
This app is trash waste of space and battery consumption I have came in to contact with lots of people with covid this app has not gone off once to let me know

Overreaching, evil tracking, just so govt can get you used to "social tracking" & who you intact with Edit 5/2021: thank you for the reply. Establishing a list of recipients to alert requires the app to connect to and extange information from nearby bluetooth devices, running continuously/silently in the background. Monitoring the individuals we interact with in 6ft. It is not anonymous if the app can identify the user to alert them, there is an unique traceable indentifier somewhere
replyContent: No, not at all. This app simply uses bluetooth to alert you and those around you if have been exposed to COVID. This app is not a tracker, or social recorder. It simply alerts you if you have been exposed. If you become positive it would alert people who have been within 6ft of your phone. completely anonymously

content: Not enough adoption I'm guessing

I don't normally rate apps. Just looking through all the reviews and it's a shame that people ignorant to how the app actually works are leaving negative reviews. Download the app. Let it run. If you test positive, record it in the app. If someone else running this app tests positive and records it in the app, you will receive an alert (If you were near that person for more than 15min). Other than that, the app will silently run until something happens. It's not that hard to understand...
Was expose but the app did not let me know

I've had this app on my phone for months and it hasn't alerted once! How is that possible when I go to Wal-Mart and run errands at least once a week. I also noticed that no matter how many hours I'm out and about the ONLY time it does its random checks is when I'm home! One day in particular I was in and out of my house a couple of times and I compared the documented checks with my Google maps log and all 4 checks were while I was obviously home! This app is totally useless if NO ONE USES IT!!
replyContent: The app will only alert you if you are within 15 feet for 15 min, walking around a store will more than likely not trip the notification. The checks you are seeing are simply the uplink to the server that records the phones you were near. That way it can notify those devices.

content: This was a crock of shiitt

content: Never alerts, like ever. I know a few people around me got it and it wasn't reported.

Great idea in need of more widespread usage. I have no issue having my anonymous data help people I am in proximity with. I have not gotten any alerts, but I tend to not be out and about a lot during the pandemic so I'm probably less susceptible than many.
THAT HOW I CUT TO NOW ABOUT THIS VIRUS

content: This app only allows you to share Covid-19 test results. It should also allow you to share close contacts. Due to the time of night, currently 10:48pm, we're unable to get tested ourselves. We should be able to alert anyone through the app that we may have contracted the virus BEFORE being tested. Early detection is key with any illness. Please add this function.
Pointless app. I've had one exposure alert.

This works when all three are enabled on the Covid positive patient's phone. This is why its so important for residents to install the app and activate the utility when asked.

content: Great

content: Not useful at all. Based on responses by the Dev, this app uses Bluetooth to communicate with other phones that have the app and are atleast 6ft from you for 15 min...that means if someone is in my 6ft circumference and has COVID but walks away before the 15 min, the app won't notify me?
replyContent: This based on CDC guide lines. No Zak it wont as you were not with in the parameters that would cause a need to get tested.

content: The way I understand it, you only get notifications if an exposed person has downloaded this app and gives permission to share data. Those who have been exposed but saw no alert, the person may not have had this app. The app is only as accurate as the number of people using it; it's open-source data collection and completely voluntary. More residents should download this app.
replyContent: Thank you for downloading our app. We'd love to earn 5 stars, so please write to us at DPH.CovidAlertCT@ct.gov suggesting what we can do to improve.

content: I love it

But it is the CT Department of Public Heath that generates the release "keys" s it is only possible to release the notifications for tests on residents of CT. **SMcC DPH admin**

content: Great

After deep diving the privacy claims of this app, I feel given it's a fully voluntary system that if you're concerned about covid-19 infection/spread, this app is a useful tool to protect yourself/loved ones while also contributing to the greater good by stopping the spread. Unlike other w reviews, I have had no noticable battery issues B-LE feature on my Note 9. Lost 1 star for some UX bugs I'm sure will be resolved soon.
replyContent: Nick - You are correct this does not collect any personal information through the app and is uses the low power Bluetooth. Thank you for your support. ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: I live in Taunton, MA & don't travel much. Is it OK to use this until Massachusetts releases one if at all? If it's useless unless I am in or near CT please let me know and I'll uninstall it.

As as a Mass resident we would not know your notification key. Thank you for your support. ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: Impressive. I recall an era when individuals whom presented a threat to the health of others were the ones quarantined. Ugh.
replyContent: Thank you for downloading and supporting this App. Our hope is that wide spread use of this technology in CT will help others stay safe when people they are around, have been tested positive. Thank you for your support. ** SMcC DPH Admin **
